lines.content: Duke is a Personal Assistant Chatbot that helps a person to keep track of various things.
There are 3 types of tasks that can be added to the task list
Lists all the tasks currently stored in the task list
Deletes a task from your task list with a specified index
Find all the tasks currently stored in the task list which contains a specific substring
Automatically stores users' task list into the hard drive of their computer. The task list can be loaded up upon startup of the program again.
Adds a new todo task to the task list. The description of the task has to be provided.
* Creates a new todo task to be added to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a new deadline task to the task list. The description and the deadline of the task has to be provided.
* Creates a new deadline task to be added to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a new event task to the task list. The description and the duration of the task has to be provided.
* Creates a new event task to be added to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Displays all the tasks currently stored in the task list.
* Lists all the tasks in the order they were added
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task with the given index by the user as completed. The index has to be a number from 1 to the size of the task list.
* Marks the task at index 1 of the task list as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmark a task with the given index by the user as not completed. The index has to be a number from 1 to the size of the task list.
* Unmark the task at index 1 of the task list as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes the task with the given index by the user from the task list. The index has to be a number from 1 to the size of the task list.
* Deletes the task of index 1 from the task list
* Displays remaining number of tasks in the list
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds the tasks with similar substring given by the user from the task list.
* Find and display the tasks with description that contains the given substring in the task list
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Closes and exits the program, Duke
* Program outputs an exit message and closes the program
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* The main class. Reads in different commands from the user, and parses them accordingly.
public static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
* Main method called when the program is running.
* @param args Not used, should be empty.
* Parent class for other Command objects.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Returns a boolean to determine whether the program should terminate.
* @return False at the start as program just started running.
* Command for adding a deadline task to the task list.
* Constructor that constructs a command that will add a deadline task to the task list.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the deadline command, description and due time.
* Executes the command to create a new deadline task which will be
* added to the task list and database.
* @param taskList The task list that the new deadline task is added to.
* Command for adding a deadline task to the task list.
* Constructs a command that will add an event task to the task list.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the deadline command, description and due time.
* @throws EmptyCommandException The exception thrown when user only inputs the command.
* Executes the command to create a new event task which will be
* added to the task list and database.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on
Task currTask = new Event(description, from, to);
* Command for adding a todo task to the task list
* Constructor to initialise the CreateToDoCommand that will add a todo task to the task list.
* @param cases Array that contains the task and description.
* @throws EmptyCommandException The exception thrown when user enters a command with no description.
* Executes the command to create a new todo task which will be
* added to the task list and database.
* @param taskList The task list that the new todo task is added to.
* Command for deleting a task from the task list.
* Constructs a command that will delete the task at the given index from the task list.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the command and the index.
* @param taskList The task list to be referenced from for the deleting of the task at the index.
*                 Used for identifying if the index is out of bounds.
* @throws InvalidIndexException The exception thrown when user enters an invalid index.
* @throws EmptyCommandException The exception thrown when user did not input the index.
public DeleteTaskCommand(String[] cases, TaskList taskList) throws InvalidIndexException, EmptyIndexException {
* Deletes the task with the index specified in the constructor from the task list.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on
* Displays the message when user inputs the exit command.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Sets isRunning to be false to terminate the program.
* @return True to allow the program to stop running.
* Command for finding tasks that contains similar string specified by the user.
* Constructs a command that will display tasks containing the specified string.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the command and the keyword used to filter.
* @throws EmptyFilterException Exception thrown when user did not enter any keyword to filter.
* Displays a task list filtered based on the search string specified.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Command generated when there is an error in parsing the user inputs.
* Constructs a command that displays an error message
* when there is an error in parsing user inputs.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Command generated for marking a task to be completed.
* Constructs a command to set the completion status of a task to be done.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the command and the index.
* @param taskList The task list to be referenced from for the marking of the task.
*                 Checks for whether the index is out of bounds.
* @throws InvalidIndexException The exception thrown when user enters an invalid index.
* @throws EmptyCommandException The exception thrown when user did not input the index.
public MarkTaskCommand (String[] cases, TaskList taskList) throws InvalidIndexException, EmptyIndexException {
* Sets the completion status of the task at the specified index to be true.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Class containing method for parsing the commands.
* Parses the user input into a command that can be executed
* @param userInput A string that represents the user's input into the terminal.
* @param taskList The task list that the parsed command will be executed on
* @return A command that can be executed by calling the execute method.
public static Command handleUserInputs(String userInput, TaskList taskList){
* Command for displaying the tasks in the task list.
* Displays the tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* Command generated to unmark a task to be not completed.
* Constructs a command to set the completion status of a task to be undone.
* @param cases An array of string that contains the command and the index.
* @param taskList The task list to be referenced from to unmark the task.
*      *           Checks for whether the index is out of bounds.
* @throws InvalidIndexException The exception thrown when user enters an invalid index.
* @throws EmptyIndexException The exception thrown when user did not input the index.
public UnmarkTaskCommand (String[] cases, TaskList taskList) throws InvalidIndexException, EmptyIndexException {
* Sets the completion status of the task at the specified index to be false.
* @param taskList The task list that the command is executed on.
* The main parent exception class that other exceptions inherit unique to the Duke program
* The exception that is being thrown when only the task command is given
* but there is no description to the task
* Thrown when user did not enter the substring for find.
* Thrown when user leaves the index of a command to be empty
* The exception that is being thrown when the task given is not recognised by
* The exception that is being thrown when an invalid index of the list is given
* such as a number that is bigger than the list size
* Storage class that handles the saving of the task list as a file and loading the tasks from the file.
* Constructor of the Database class that creates a new file and directory if they do not exist
* and initialises and creates a new Arraylist of tasks with the tasks previously saved.
* Appends the newly added task to the saved database txt file.
* @param userInput String of the task in a fixed format that has been newly added to the task list.
* @throws IOException Executes when the FileWriter fails to append the task.
public void appendSaveTasks(String userInput) throws IOException {
* Updates the database when a task is being removed from the list or when a task is being marked/unmarked.
* @throws IOException Executes when the FileWriter fails to update the txt file.
* Initialises the Database by adding saved task from the saved txt file to the task list.
* @param savedFile The txt file that is being saved to store previous tasks on the list.
* @throws IOException Executes when the scanner fails to scan or task list fails to add saved task.
private void initialisation(File savedFile) throws IOException{
* Convert the saved string from the saved file to a task object
* so that it can be added to the list.
* @param taskInput The saved string being read from the file.
* @return Returns the task object that is represented by the saved string.
* Determines if the task is mark as done from the saved string in the saved file.
* @param mark The string that represents whether the task has been marked/unmarked.
* @param task The task that is currently being added to the list.
private void updateMark(String mark, Task task) {
* Deadline class that keeps track of the task object with an additional deadline parameter.
* The deadline in which the task should be completed by.
* Constructs a deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Time that the task should be completed by.
* Converts the deadline task into its string representation which contains
* information such as the task type, completion status, description and due date.
* @return String representation of the deadline task.
* Converts the deadline task into a format to be saved in the database.
* @return String representation of the deadline task meant for saving into the database.
* Event class that keeps track of the task object with an additional duration parameter,
* String representation of when the event starts.
* String representation of when the event ends.
* Constructs an event task with the given description and duration.
* @param description Description of the event task.
* @param from String representation of when the event starts.
* @param to String representation of when the event ends.
public Event (String description, String from, String to){
* Converts the task into its string representation which contains
* information such as the task type, completion status, description, start and end times.
* @return String representation of the event task.
* Converts the event task into a format to be saved in the database.
* @return String representation of the event task meant for saving into the database.
* Parent class for task objects. Other subclasses inherit from this class.
* String that provides the description of the task.
* Boolean value on whether the task is marked as done or not.
* Constructor of the task object which initialises its description and
* Returns the status icon to represent whether the task has been marked.
* @return String icon that represents marked or unmarked.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* @param done boolean to determine whether task should be marked as completed.
* Checks if the task description contains the specified string.
* @param filter The string that the task description will be searched for
* @return A boolean based on whether the task description contains the filter string
* Converts the task into its string representation which contains
* information such as its status icon and its description.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Converts the task into a format to be saved in the database.
* @return String representation of the task meant for saving into the database.
* Task list class that contains the current list of task objects.
* Constructor of the TaskList where it takes in the stored tasks in the database's Arraylist of tasks.
* Returns the current number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The current number of tasks in the task list.
* Appends the given task inputted by the user to the task list and the database.
* @param task The task that would be added into task list and the database.
* Retrieves the task at the given index of the task list.
* @param index The given index that corresponds to the position of a task in a list.
* @return The task at the given index of the task list.
* Deletes the task at the given index of the task list.
* @param index The given index that corresponds to the position of a task in a list.
* Marks the task as done/not done based on the boolean isDone
* @param index The given index of the task to be set as done or not done
* @param isDone The boolean which determines whether a task is marked or unmarked
public void setDone(int index, boolean isDone) {
* Appends the task to the database.
* @param currTask The task that is to be added and saved in the database.
System.out.println("Failed to append task to database");
* Todo class that keeps track of the task object and its description.
* Constructs a todo task with the given description.
* @param description String description of the todo task.
* Converts the todo task into its string representation which contains
* information such as the task type, completion status and description.
* @return String representation of the todo task.
* Converts the todo task into a format to be saved in the database.
* @return String representation of the todo task meant for saving into the database.
* Class that contains methods to send messages to users depending on what they input.
* String of underscores that represents a divider in the terminal.
* Prints out the long line, divider on a new line.
* Displays a welcome message when program starts running.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays an exit message when user exits the program by inputting 'bye'.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays the current number of tasks in the task list.
* @param listCount The current number of tasks in the list.
System.out.println("Now you have " + Integer.toString(listCount) + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message to inform user that the task had been removed.
* Displays the message when a task is being added into the list
* and the updated number of tasks in the list.
* @param taskList The task list that the task was added to, to be referenced for the
*                 number of tasks and the task added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Integer.toString(taskList.listCount()) + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message to inform user that the task has been marked.
* @param taskList The task list to be referenced from for the marking of the task.
* @param index The index of task in the task list that the user wants to mark.
public static void markDoneMessage(TaskList taskList, int index) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message to inform user that the task marking has been removed.
* @param taskList The task list to be referenced from for the removing of the mark of the task.
* @param index The index of task in the task list that the user wants to unmark.
public static void markUndoneMessage(TaskList taskList, int index){
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays an opening message when user inputs  'list'.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message when user inputs 'find'.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Displays an error message when user inputs an invalid command.
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Displays an error message when user inputs an empty command.
* @param command The string for the corresponding task being inputted.
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a " + command + " cannot be empty.");
* Displays an error message when user inputs an index that is out of bounds or does not exist.
System.out.println("No such task exist! Try again.");
* Displays an error message when user did not enter the index after a command that needs an index.
System.out.println("Index of the command cannot be empty!");
* Displays an error message when user did not enter a keyword for the find command.
System.out.println("Please enter a keyword. The keyword cannot be left empty");
